title: 112_s170
content: The Act titled "Helping Responsible Homeowners Act" allows for affordable refinancing of mortgages owned or guaranteed by Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac. The "Helping Responsible Homeowners Act" defines key terms such as Director, Enterprise, and Qualified mortgage, which pertains to mortgages on one to four-family dwellings. The "Helping Responsible Homeowners Act" defines a refinancing mortgage as a mortgage on a one to four-family dwelling that is owned or guaranteed by the Federal National Mortgage Association or the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation, and the mortgagor is current on payments. The "Helping Responsible Homeowners Act" defines a refinancing mortgage as a mortgage on a one to four-family dwelling owned or guaranteed by Fannie Mae or Freddie Mac, with the mortgagor current on payments. The refinancing mortgage must be used to pay off all debt under an existing qualified mortgage and any associated closing costs. The refinancing mortgage must include the same property as the qualified mortgage being refinanced and have a fair interest rate not exceeding 40 basis points above the required net yield for a prime conventional conforming fixed rate mortgage. The refinancing mortgage must have a fair interest rate not exceeding 40 basis points above the required net yield for a prime conventional conforming fixed rate mortgage. The mortgage shall not be limited by the loan-to-value ratio, and all penalties for prepayment or refinancing of the qualified mortgage being refinanced must be waived. The Federal National Mortgage Association and the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation shall provide refinancing for qualified mortgages on single-family housing with a term to maturity of not more than 40 years. The Federal National Mortgage Association and the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation will provide refinancing for qualified mortgages on single-family housing through a program established by the Director of the Federal Housing Finance Agency. This program prohibits Loan Level Price Adjustments and Post Settlement Delivery Fees. (c) Prohibition on Loan Level Price Adjustments and Post Settlement Delivery Fees.--The Federal National Mortgage Association and the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation will not charge any up-front fee beyond the standard guarantee fee for refinancing qualified mortgages. Resubordination of Second Liens--Servicers or creditors holding a second lien on a qualified mortgage must allow resubordination to enable refinancing, or new mortgages originated by them will be ineligible for purchase or guarantee by the Federal agencies. Qualified mortgages originated by a servicer or creditor will be ineligible for purchase or guarantee by Federal agencies if they do not allow refinancing. The requirement to refinance qualified mortgages does not apply after one year from the enactment of the Act, but the Director may extend the program in one-year increments at their discretion. The Director will issue regulations or guidance for the program established under this section, with requirements applying in 1-year increments during any extension. The Federal National Mortgage Association and the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation must ensure that mortgage servicers inform borrowers about the refinancing program. The Director will include updates on the program in the monthly Foreclosure Prevention & Refinance Report.
